top_comments.comment: I feel proud whenever I recognize a piece

comments_since_last_sample.body:
This video was an unexpected pleasure. It was simple, effective and
Had me guessing although I couldn't guess the next piece. It also has me wondering because Parry, I have been led to believe,  was a second rate composer but I'm not so sure now. I'm going to check it out. Thanks!
Keep up this kind of format. Great stuff. :)

Kapustin making an appearance on the list was a good call. He has a lot of good piano music. As a pianist, a piano piece I would put on a list like this is "Piano Folio... to a disappeared Pleiad" by Japanese composer Takashi Yoshimatsu. There's also a bunch of choral music by Baltic composers like Korvits, Dubra, Kreek, Vast, Pelecis, Plakidis, and many others that should be more popular.
Since you liked Parry, here's another English compser to look into - Ivor Gurney.
The Schumann is one of my favorites.  Recommend people also check out his better known Piano Quintet, Op. 44
Really liked this presentation - some new music to go study... Thank you so much.
